sen.j: 今出川 実種（いまでがわ さねたね、宝暦4年6月4日 (旧暦)（1754年7月23日） - 享和元年6月22日 (旧暦)（1801年8月1日））は、江戸時代中期から後期の公卿。
sen.e: Sanetane IMADEGAWA (born on July 23, 1754 and died on August 1, 1801) was Kugyo (a Court noble) in the middle and the late of the Edo period.
Sanetane IMADEGAWA (July 23, 1754 - August 1, 1801) was Kugyo (a Court noble) in the middle and the late of the Edo period.
Sanetane IMADEGAWA (July 23, 1754 - August 1, 1801) was Kugyo (a Court noble) in the middle and the late of the Edo period.

sen.j: 桃園天皇（116代）から光格天皇（119代）にいたる四帝にわたり仕え、官位は従一位内大臣まで昇った。
sen.e: He served four Emperors from the Emperor Momozono (the 116th) to the Emperor Kokaku (the 119th) and he rose to the official rank of Juichii (Junior First Rank), Naidaijin (the minister of the center).

He served four Emperors from the Emperor Momozono (the 116th) to the Emperor Kokaku (the 119th) and he rose to the official rank of Juichii (Junior First Rank), Naidaijin (the minister of the center).

He served four Emperors from the Emperor Momozono (the 116th) to the Emperor Kokaku (the 119th) and he rose to the official rank of Juichii (Junior First Rank), Naidaijin (the minister of the center).

sen.j: 父は内大臣西園寺公晃。
sen.e: His father was Naidaijin, Kinaki SAIONJI.
His father was Naidaijin, Kinaki SAIONJI.
His father was Naidaijin, Kinaki SAIONJI.
His mother was unknown.
His mother was unknown.
His mother was unknown.

sen.j: 室は水戸藩主徳川宗翰の娘。
sen.e: His wife was a daughter of the lord of the Mito Domain, Munemoto TOKUGAWA.
His lawful wife was a daughter of the lord of the Mito Domain, Munemoto TOKUGAWA.
His lawful wife was a daughter of the lord of the Mito Domain, Munemoto TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 子息に大納言今出川尚季、娘に徳大寺公迪室がいる。
sen.e: Dainagon (the chief councilor of the state), Naosue IMADEGAWA was his son and a wife of Kinmichi DAITOKUJI was his daughter.
Dainagon (the chief councilor of the state), Naosue IMADEGAWA was his son and a wife of Kinmichi DAITOKUJI was his daughter.
Dainagon (the chief councilor of the state), Naosue IMADEGAWA was his son and a wife of Kinmichi DAITOKUJI was his daughter.
He was also named Koichirinin.
sen.cmt: 後一林院の読み方をKoichirininとしました。
sen.e: His pseudonym was 後一林院.
sen.cmt: 「号」を「pseudonym」に変更しました。読み方が不明な「後一林院」を漢字にしました。
sen.e: His pseudonym was 後一林院.

sen.j: 宝暦10年（1760年）に今出川公言の養子となり、同年に叙爵。
sen.e: In 1760, he was adopted into Kinkoto IMADEGAWA and during this year, the peerage was conferred on him.
In 1760, he was adopted into Kinkoto IMADEGAWA and in the same year, the peerage was conferred on him.
sen.cmt: 「同年に」を「in the same year」に変更しました。
sen.e: In 1760, he was adopted into Kinkoto IMADEGAWA and in the same year, the peerage was conferred on him.

sen.j: 以降累進して侍従・左近衛権少将・右近衛中将を経て、明和3年（1766年）に従三位となり、公卿に列する。
sen.e: Since then, he got promoted rapidly taking various positions such as Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff), Sakonoe no gon no shosho (Provisional Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) and Ukonoe no chujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), and then, in 1766, he received the official rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) to rank with Kugyo.
sen.cmt: http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%BB%8A%E5%87%BA%E5%B7%9D%E5%AE%9F%E7%A8%AE より、「侍従・近衛府・近衛府を経て」→「侍従・左近衛権少将・右近衛中将を経て」に変更しました。
sen.e: Since then, he got promoted rapidly taking various positions such as Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff), Sakonoe no gon no shosho (Provisional Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) and Ukonoe no chujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), and then, in 1766, he received the official rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) to rank with Kugyo.

Since then, he got promoted rapidly taking various positions such as Jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff), Sakonoe no gon no shosho (Provisional Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) and Ukonoe no chujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), and then, in 1766, he received the official rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) to rank with Kugyo.

sen.j: その後踏歌節会外弁や中納言を経て、安永4年（1775年）に従二位権大納言、また大歌所別当となる。
sen.e: In 1755, he received the official rank of Junii (Junior Second Rank), Dainagon (the chief councilor of the state) and became Outadokoro (an organization that provided training and management for ancient Japanese music and traditional instruments) no betto (superintendent) after he assumed Toka no sechie Geben (an official who organized and supervised formal ceremonies at the Imperial Court) and Chunagon (vice-councilor of the state).

In 1755, he received the official rank of Junii (Junior Second Rank), 権大納言 and became Outadokoro no betto (a superintendent at an organization that provided training and management for ancient Japanese music and traditional instruments) after he assumed Toka no sechie Geben (an official who organized and supervised formal ceremonies at the Imperial Court) and Chunagon (vice-councilor of the state).
sen.cmt: 「大歌所別当」の訳を以下に変更：Outadokoro no betto (a superintendent at an organization that provided training and management for ancient Japanese music and traditional instruments)原文の「大納言」の部分が、ウィキでは「権大納言」になっています。
sen.e: In 1755, he received the official rank of Junii (Junior Second Rank), Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of the state) and became Outadokoro no betto (a superintendent at an organization that provided training and management for ancient Japanese music and traditional instruments) after he assumed Toka no sechie Geben (an official who organized and supervised formal ceremonies at the Imperial Court) and Chunagon (vice-councilor of the state).
sen.cmt: 権大納言→Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of the state)

sen.e: In 1776, he resigned from betto.
The following year, he resigned from betto.
sen.cmt: 「In 1776」を「the following year」に変更しました。
sen.e: The following year, he resigned from betto.

sen.j: 安永8年（1779年）には内教坊別当となる。
sen.e: In 1779, he became Naikyobo no betto (superintendent of Naikyobo where officials gave training of singing and dancing).
In 1779, he became Naikyobo no betto (superintendent of Naikyobo where officials gave training of singing and dancing).
In 1779, he became Naikyobo no betto (superintendent of Naikyobo where officials gave training of singing and dancing).

sen.j: 寛政10年（1798年）には内大臣と右近衛大将に任じられた。
sen.e: In 1798, he was appointed to be Naidaijin and Konoefu.
In 1798, he was appointed to be Naidaijin and Ukone no daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 原文の「近衛府」の部分が、ウィキでは「右近衛大将」となっています。「近衛府」は「右近衛大将」のリンク先のようです。
sen.e: In 1798, he was appointed to be Naidaijin and Ukone no daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards).
In 1799, he was resigned.
The following year, he resigned.
sen.cmt: 「In 1799」を「the next year」に変更しました。
sen.e: The following year, he resigned.

sen.j: 寛政12年（1800年）に従一位を授与された。
sen.e: In 1800, he received the official title of Juichii (Junior First Rank).
In 1800, he received Juichii (Junior First Rank).
sen.cmt: 「the official title of」を削除しました。
sen.e: In 1800, he received Juichii (Junior First Rank).
